lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* FriendlyBotSakura is a simple flower-themed task manager bot.
* Constructs a Storage object with the given file path.
* @param filePath The path to the storage file.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return list of tasks loaded from file
// parts[3] is the date string in yyyy-MM-dd format
Task event = new Event(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
System.out.println("File not found. Starting with empty list.");
* Clears all contents of the storage file.
* If the file does not exist, it is created automatically.
* Represents a Deadline task: a subclass of Task class.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Constructs a Deadline task with description and due date/time.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param byString the due date string in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @throws SakuraException if the date format is invalid
public Deadline(String description, String byString) throws SakuraException {
throw new SakuraException("Invalid date format! Please use yyyy-MM-dd");
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return string including task type, details, and due date/time
* Returns a formatted string for saving this task to storage.
* Represents an Event task with start and end times.
* Constructs an Event task with description, start time, and end time.
* @param from the start time of the event
* @param to the end time of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return string including task type, details, start time, and end time
* Returns the storage string format of the Event task.
* @return a formatted string for saving the event in storage
* @param message the message as a string
* Represents a single Task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* @param description the string description of the task
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns whether this task is done via boolean variable
* Updates the description of this task.
* Sets the done status of this task.
* Returns the status symbol for this task.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task including status and description.
* Manages a list of tasks and provides methods to add, remove,
* mark as done, or mark as not done. Changes are saved to storage.
* Creates a TaskList and loads tasks from the given storage.
* @param storage Storage object to load and save tasks.
* Adds a task and saves the updated list.
* Removes the task at the specified index and saves the list.
* @param index Index of the task to remove.
* @throws SakuraException If the index is invalid.
public Task removeTask(int index) throws SakuraException {
* Marks the task at the given index as done and saves the list.
* @param index Index of the task to mark as done.
* @throws SakuraException If the index is invalid.
public void markTaskDone(int index) throws SakuraException {
* Marks the task at the given index as not done and saves the list.
* @throws SakuraException If the index is invalid.
public void markTaskNotDone(int index) throws SakuraException {
* Returns a list of tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* Constructs a ToDo with the given description.
* @param description the description of the ToDo task
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return string including task type and details
* Handles all user interaction and input parsing for the Sakura task manager.
* Constructs a Ui instance with the given task list.
* @param taskList TaskList to be managed by this Ui.
* Starts the UI, prompting the user for commands until "bye" is entered.
"Hi, I am your friendly bot \uD83C\uDF38Sakura\uD83C\uDF38, feel free to let me know what you need!");
System.out.println(" Bye, I wish you a pleasant day!\uD83C\uDF37");
" Please Retry: You need to enter a valid number for the task.\uD83C\uDF38\uD83D\uDE22");
* Processes a single user input command.
* @throws SakuraException If the input format is invalid.
private void processInput(String input) throws SakuraException {
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF38Here are the tasks in your list\uD83C\uDF38:");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37I have marked this task as not done:");
"\uD83C\uDF38The description of a todo cannot be empty, please reenter!!!\uD83C\uDF38");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37You now have " + taskList.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new SakuraException("\uD83C\uDF38Please use the actual format properly!\uD83C\uDF38");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37You now have " + taskList.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new SakuraException("\uD83C\uDF38Please use the actual format properly!\uD83C\uDF38");
throw new SakuraException("\uD83C\uDF38Description, start time and end time cannot be empty.\uD83C\uDF38");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37You now have " + taskList.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskList.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" \uD83C\uDF37Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
throw new SakuraException("I do not know what that means.\uD83C\uDF38\uD83D\uDE22");
* Minimal unit tests for A-JUnit requirement
// Create a ToDo and verify initial state
assertFalse(todo.getDone(), "new todo should not be done");
assertTrue(todo.getDone(), "todo should be marked done after markAsDone()");
assertEquals(expected, todo.SavingFormat(), "SavingFormat should reflect done status and description");
// use yyyy-MM-dd input as your Deadline expects (e.g., 2023-08-20)
// getBy() should exist and return a LocalDate (this method is present in your Deadline)
assertNotNull(d.getBy(), "Deadline.getBy() should not be null for valid date");
// toString should contain the formatted date "Aug 20 2023" as per your OUTPUT formatter
assertTrue(s.contains("submit report"), "toString() should include the description");
//  invalid month should cause constructor to throw SakuraException
